meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a child in behavior or attitude.
meanings.sent1: Her childlike enthusiasm for the playground was infectious.
meanings.sent2: The painting captured the childlike joy of playing in the sand.
meanings.sent3: Seeing the grown man jump with childlike glee was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her childlike wonder at the stars made everyone stop and look up.
meanings.sent5: The childlike innocence in her eyes melted even the toughest hearts.

meanings.definition: Innocent, trusting, or naive in a way that is typical of a child.
meanings.sent1: His childlike belief in fairy tales was endearing.
meanings.sent2: She had a childlike faith in the goodness of people.
meanings.sent3: The childlike trust he placed in his imaginary friend was charming.
meanings.sent4: Her childlike innocence shone through in every smile.
meanings.sent5: The childlike curiosity in his questions was a joy to witness.
